intro: Stachys albens, commonly known as silverweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Stachys albens is also known for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
